instruction: If a customer inquires about purchasing insurance and states they are not a US resident, do not ask which US state they will visit. Instead, inform them that Faye insurance is only available to US residents of all states, except for residents of the following US territories: United States Virgin Islands, Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Puerto Rico.
input: Hi, I need help purchasing travel insurance. I‚Äôm not a US resident, I‚Äôm from Queensland. Can I buy Faye insurance for my trip?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! Faye insurance is only available to US residents of all states, except for residents of the following US territories: United States Virgin Islands, Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Puerto Rico.
agent_answer:
Hello!

Thank you for reaching out. üòä I‚Äôd be happy to help with your travel insurance needs. However, Faye insurance is only available to residents of the United States, with a few exceptions for specific US territories. Unfortunately, as a resident of Queensland, you wouldn‚Äôt be eligible to purchase Faye insurance at this time.

If there's anything else I can assist you with or if you have more questions, please feel free to let me know. Safe travels! ‚úàÔ∏è
reason: The agent accurately conveyed that Faye insurance is only available to US residents and specified that residents from certain US territories are ineligible. Although the agent did not list the territories explicitly, they maintained the core information that non-US residents, like someone from Queensland, cannot purchase Faye insurance. The tone is friendly and helpful, consistent with the expected response. The additional information about assistance with travel insurance needs does not detract from the core message and is acceptable.

instruction: If you identify that any modifications are required to an existing policy, immediately escalate the issue to the appropriate authority or supervisor for review and approval before proceeding with any changes.
input: Hi, I'm from NY. I bought a policy and noticed there's a typo in my last name. I need you to change it.
expected_answer: Thanks for letting me know! Since this involves a modification to an existing policy, I‚Äôll need to escalate your request to the appropriate authority for review and approval before any changes can be made. I‚Äôll pass this along right away.
agent_answer: Hi there! Thanks for bringing this to my attention. To ensure we get everything corrected for you, I'll need to escalate your request to a human agent who can review and approve the change to your policy. Please hold on for a moment while I make the transfer. üòä
reason: The agent successfully identified the need to escalate the request to a human agent for review and approval, which aligns with the core instruction to escalate modifications to an existing policy. Although the phrasing differs slightly, it conveys the same essential logic and includes the critical step of escalation. Additionally, the agent provided reassurance by indicating they would handle the transfer, which adds a positive tone to the interaction.

instruction: If a customer continues to experience issues with any part of the quoting process after receiving one troubleshooting message, immediately escalate the issue to the appropriate support team.
input: Hi, I'm from MO. Your quote link is broken, and the troubleshooting you sent me doesn't work. What do I do?
expected_answer: I'm sorry you're still having trouble with the quote process. Since the issue persists after troubleshooting, I'll escalate this to our support team right away so they can assist you further.
agent_answer: Hi there! I'm sorry to hear that you're still having trouble with the quote link. To ensure you get the help you need, I'll need to escalate your request to one of our human agents who can provide further assistance. They'll review your case and get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience!
reason: The agent's response indicates that they are escalating the issue to human agents for further assistance, which aligns with the instruction to escalate the issue. The tone is empathetic and supportive, matching the expected response. While it includes additional information about the review process, the core logic of escalating the issue is maintained, thus fulfilling the requirements of the instruction.

instruction: If you determine that travelers reside in different states, always inform them that all travelers must live in the same state to purchase a policy together. Advise them that if they live in different states, they must purchase separate policies, even if their question was about a different topic.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. I want to buy coverage for my family trip. We are 4 ‚Äî I'm Bobby Lee and my wife Andrew Santino are flying from CA to Mexico, and our daughter Rudy Jules is flying from Texas. We fly from 25/12/25 to 25/01/26. How much would it cost?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! Since some travelers live in different states, you won‚Äôt be able to purchase a single policy together. All travelers must reside in the same state to be on one policy. Because your daughter lives in Texas while you and your wife live in California, you‚Äôll need to purchase separate policies for each state. I‚Äôm happy to help guide you through each one.
agent_answer:
Hello Bobby! üòä

Thank you for reaching out. It sounds like you have an exciting family trip planned to Mexico! To ensure everyone is covered, you'll need to purchase separate policies since your daughter, Rudy, will be traveling from Texas. Each state requires travelers to have their own policy if they're purchasing from different locations.

Could you please provide more details, such as the type of coverage you're interested in? This way, I can assist you better in determining the cost and options available for you and your family. Feel free to ask any other questions as well‚ÄîI'm here to help!
reason: The agent correctly informed the user that they need to purchase separate policies because the travelers reside in different states (Texas and California). The communication maintained a friendly tone, provided additional information about coverage, and prompted the user for further details, which aligns with the expected instruction. Overall, the core logic and necessary information were conveyed effectively.

instruction: When a customer asks about travel to a U.S. Department of State Level 4 ("Do Not Travel") destination, state that coverage is unavailable and do not list any benefits. This applies regardless of state of residence.
input: Hi, I'm from TX. I want to visit my family in Afghanistan. I believe it's a Level 4 country. How much will it cost? Will it cost extra because of it?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. Coverage is unavailable for travel to any U.S. Department of State Level 4 (‚ÄúDo Not Travel‚Äù) destination, including Afghanistan. We‚Äôre unable to offer a policy for this trip.
agent_answer: Hi there! üòä It's wonderful that you're planning to visit your family. While I understand your excitement, I must inform you that we currently don't provide coverage for travel to Afghanistan due to its Level 4 status. It's always advisable to check the latest travel advisories and explore other options for securing coverage. If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out. Safe travels!
reason: The agent provided accurate information about the unavailability of coverage for travel to a U.S. Department of State Level 4 destination, specifically mentioning Afghanistan. While the agent added more information about checking travel advisories and exploring other options, it did not detract from the core message, which aligns with the expected answer. The tone was friendly and informative, maintaining the essence of the guidance given in the instruction.

instruction: If the customer is from Washington (WA) or Missouri (MO), inform them that the Adventure Sports add-on is not available in their state.
input: Hi, I'm from Washington, and I want to do extreme white-water rafting in Skykomish. How much for adding this coverage?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! The Adventure Sports add-on is not available for residents of Washington, so unfortunately it can‚Äôt be added to your policy.
agent_answer: Hi there! üòä I'm glad you're looking into staying safe while enjoying your extreme white-water rafting adventure in Skykomish. However, I'm sorry to let you know that the Adventure Sports add-on is not available in Washington. If there's anything else I can help you with or if you need more information on available coverage options, please feel free to ask!
reason: The agent correctly informed the customer that the Adventure Sports add-on is not available in Washington, which aligns with the instructions given. Although the agent provided additional information and a friendly tone, it did not detract from the core message. Overall, the key information is present, and the response meets the expectations outlined in the instruction.

instruction: Currently, Faye does not offer an annual plan as we've determined that we can provide the most value with coverage for individual trips.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. Look, I fly a lot and it's really frustrating to buy a coverage policy each time. Can you do an annual plan for me?
expected_answer: I hear you ‚Äî frequent travel can make this process feel repetitive. At the moment, Faye does not offer an annual plan, as we‚Äôve found we can provide the most value through coverage for individual trips. I'm happy to help you with a new trip policy anytime you need one.
agent_answer:
Hi there! üòä

I understand the inconvenience of purchasing coverage for each trip, especially if you fly frequently. At the moment, we don't offer an annual plan because we've found that we can provide the most value with coverage tailored to individual trips. 

However, we'd be more than happy to help you with a quote for your upcoming trips. You can get started by visiting this link: www.withfaye.com/quote/destination.

Let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with! Safe travels! ‚úàÔ∏è
reason: The agent answered correctly by providing the key information that Faye does not offer an annual plan and explained the reasoning behind it. The tone is friendly and matches the expected answer. Additionally, the agent offered further assistance by providing a link for quotes, which is more information than the expected answer but does not detract from the core message. Overall, the core logic and information conveyed are the same.

instruction: When responding to a customer who has lost their mobile phone, express genuine empathy by acknowledging their frustration and concern. Use a warm and understanding tone, and offer reassurance that you are there to help them through the process of resolving the issue.
input: Hi, I'm from FL and I just lost my mobile phone while traveling. I'm really stressed ‚Äî what should I do?
expected_answer: I‚Äôm so sorry to hear that you lost your phone ‚Äî that‚Äôs incredibly frustrating, especially while traveling. I‚Äôm here to help you through this. Let‚Äôs work together to figure out the next steps so you can get this resolved as quickly as possible.
agent_answer:
I'm so sorry to hear that you've lost your mobile phone while traveling. I can only imagine how stressful this situation must be for you. Please know that I'm here to help you through this process. Let's take it one step at a time. Here are some things we can do:  

- Consider checking if your phone is still within the area using a location service, like Find My Device for Android or Find My iPhone for Apple.
- If you believe it's been lost or stolen, report it to your local authorities and your phone provider as soon as possible.
- Be sure to change passwords for any sensitive accounts if your phone has access to them.

Please let me know if you need assistance on any of these steps or if there's anything else I can do to help! üòä
reason: The agent expressed genuine empathy by acknowledging the stress of the situation and provided reassurance that they are there to help. The tone is warm and understanding, matching the expected tone. Additionally, the agent included practical steps for resolving the issue, which is relevant and helpful. There is more information provided compared to the expected answer, but it aligns with the core logic and intent of the original instruction.

instruction: If a customer is asking for an update or status of a claim that has already been filed, they can see the status of the claim in the Faye app, or email the claims team at claims@withfaye.com.
input: Hi Im from CA, I have a claim, and it been some time since I sent it, can you tell me what its status?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! You can check the status of your claim directly in the Faye app. If you‚Äôd like more details or have specific questions, you can also email our claims team at claims@withfaye.com.
agent_answer:
Hello! üòä

You can check the status of your claim directly in the Faye app. Alternatively, you can also email the claims team at claims@withfaye.com for an update on your claim. If you need any further help, please feel free to let me know!
reason: The agent provided the correct key information about checking the claim status in the Faye app and the option to email the claims team. The tone is friendly and supportive, which matches the expected one, and the additional offer for further help is a positive enhancement. Overall, the core logic and information conveyed are the same, thus meeting the evaluation criteria.

instruction: The Faye app is available only on phones (Apple/Android). If a person does not want to download the app or wants to view the claim/send info about the claim on their computer, they can send an email to claims@withfaye.com.
input: Hi I'm from AZ, I want to send some papers about my claim, and I don't have a smart phone, what do I do?
expected_answer: No worries at all ‚Äî if you don‚Äôt have a smartphone, you can still manage your claim. You can email any documents or information directly to our claims team at claims@withfaye.com, and they‚Äôll take care of it for you.
agent_answer: Hi there! üòä No worries if you don't have a smartphone‚Äîthere's a straightforward way to proceed. You can send your claim documents via email to claims@withfaye.com. Just ensure you include any relevant details about your claim in the email. If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. I'm here to help!
reason: The agent provided the necessary information for managing a claim without a smartphone, correctly directing the user to email claims@withfaye.com. The response also maintained a friendly tone and added extra details about including relevant information in the email, which is acceptable. The core logic and key information from the expected answer were preserved, resulting in a successful adherence to the instruction.

instruction: When a customer asks about how to file a claim or the claim process, instruct them to file a claim using the Faye app or by sending an email to claims@withfaye.com.
input: Hi, I'm from NY. My luggage was lost on my last trip and I want to file a claim. How do I start the claim process?
expected_answer: I‚Äôm sorry to hear about your lost luggage. To file a claim or follow the claim process, you can submit it directly through the Faye app, or send an email with your details and any supporting documents to claims@withfaye.com.
agent_answer:
Hi there! üòä I'm sorry to hear about your lost luggage. Let's get that sorted out for you. You can start the claim process in two simple ways:

- **Using the Faye app**: It's quick and convenient. Just navigate to the claims section, and follow the instructions.
- **Email**: Alternatively, you can send the details of your claim directly to claims@withfaye.com.

If you need any more help or have questions, feel free to ask! I'm here to assist you.
reason: The agent provided correct instructions on how to file a claim, including both options: using the Faye app and sending an email to the provided address. The additional details on navigating the app enhance the response without deviating from the instruction. The tone is friendly and supportive, aligning with the expected answer. Overall, the essential information and core logic are consistent with the instructions.

instruction: ALWAYS share the link https://blog.withfaye.com/travel-insurance-101/covered-reasons-for-trip-cancellation/ when discussing covered reasons for trip cancellation with customers.
input: Hi, I'm from GA. I'm thinking of canceling my upcoming trip because of a family emergency. What are the covered reasons for trip cancellation?
expected_answer: I‚Äôm sorry to hear you're dealing with a family emergency. You can review all covered reasons for trip cancellation here: https://blog.withfaye.com/travel-insurance-101/covered-reasons-for-trip-cancellation/. This page explains when you may be eligible for reimbursement.
agent_answer:
Hi there! I'm sorry to hear about your family emergency. It's always tough to deal with unexpected situations like this. When it comes to trip cancellation, it's important to know what reasons are typically covered by travel insurance. You can find a comprehensive list of covered reasons for trip cancellation in this helpful article: [Covered Reasons for Trip Cancellation](https://blog.withfaye.com/travel-insurance-101/covered-reasons-for-trip-cancellation/).

If you have any further questions or need more specific information, please feel free to ask. I'm here to help! üåü
reason: The agent provided the correct link for covered reasons for trip cancellation and conveyed empathy about the customer's family emergency. The response matches the core logic of the expected answer while including additional information and maintaining a similar tone. Therefore, it complies with the instruction.

instruction: The policy is emailed to the customer immediately upon purchasing. They can also view the policy in the Faye app. If this is mentioned to them and they say they have not received this, escalate.
input: Hi, I'm from NV. I paid for a policy and got a confirmation message on the website, but I never got the policy in the app or by email. What do I do?
expected_answer: Thanks for letting me know. Since the policy is emailed immediately after purchase and should also appear in the app, and you haven‚Äôt received it in either place, I‚Äôll escalate this right away so the team can look into it for you.
agent_answer:
Hi there! üåü I'm sorry to hear about the trouble you're facing with receiving your policy. Let's see what we can do to sort it out together.

You can try checking your policy in the Faye app. If it's not showing up there, or if you haven't received an email with your policy details, please let me know and I'll be happy to assist further. 

Thanks for your patience, and I'm here to help whenever you need it!
reason: The agent did not escalate the issue as required by the instructions. While they offered assistance and mentioned checking the policy in the Faye app and email, the critical step of escalating the issue was omitted. Therefore, the agent did not follow the instructions correctly.

instruction:
When customers reach out asking Faye's contact information.

Customers can always chat with us in the Faye app, email us at support@withfaye.com or call us at 1-833-240-7056 (US/Canada). From all other locations, call us at 1-804-482-2122. We're available 24/7.
input: Hi, I'm from CO. Can you give me Faye‚Äôs contact information?
expected_answer: Of course! You can always chat with us directly in the Faye app, email us at support@withfaye.com, or call us at 1-833-240-7056 from the US or Canada. If you're traveling internationally, you can reach us at 1-804-482-2122. We're available 24/7 and here to help.
agent_answer:
Hello! üòä It's great to hear from you. Here are the ways to reach Faye‚Äôs customer support team:

**Local number:** +1 804-482-2122

**Toll-free number:** +1 833-240-7056

**Email:** support@withfaye.com

If you'd prefer to speak with someone directly, I can transfer you to a live agent right now. Would you like me to do that?
reason: The agent provided the correct contact information and maintained a friendly tone. While the format differs slightly, all key information is included: both phone numbers, the email address, and an offer to escalate to a live agent if needed. The core logic and information are the same, thus it meets the requirements laid out in the instruction.

instruction: Customers experiencing a medical situation while traveling may visit any doctor or medical facility of their choice. There is no requirement to use in-network or affiliated providers; all licensed medical professionals and facilities are acceptable.
input: Hi, I'm from MT. If I will feel sick while traveling, do I need to go to a specific clinic that works with you, or can I see any doctor?
expected_answer: If you ever feel sick while traveling, you can visit any doctor or medical facility of your choice. There‚Äôs no requirement to use an in-network or affiliated provider ‚Äî any licensed medical professional or facility is perfectly acceptable.
agent_answer: Hi there! If you feel unwell while traveling, you can visit any doctor or medical facility of your choice. There‚Äôs no requirement to use specific clinics or affiliated providers. üòä All licensed medical professionals and facilities are perfectly acceptable, so you can focus on getting the care you need without any added stress. Safe travels, and I hope you feel better soon! üåü
reason: The agent's output accurately conveys the core information from the instructions, emphasizing that customers can visit any doctor or medical facility of their choice while traveling, without needing to use in-network providers. The tone is friendly and supportive, which enhances the overall message. While there are minor wording differences and additional supportive comments, the essential information remains intact, meeting the criteria for a successful response.

instruction: If someone would like to print the policy, they can do so from the PDF that is emailed immediately after purchase.
input: Hi, I'm from OR. I want to print my policy ‚Äî how can I do that?
expected_answer: You can print your policy from the PDF that‚Äôs emailed to you immediately after purchase. Just open the PDF from your email and print it whenever you need.
agent_answer:
Hello! üòä

To print your policy, you can use the PDF that was emailed to you right after your purchase. Simply open the email, download the PDF, and print it from there. If you need any help with these steps, feel free to ask!

Take care!
reason: The agent provided the same core information as the expected answer, stating that the policy can be printed from the emailed PDF after purchase. While the wording is slightly different, the critical steps are included, such as opening the email and downloading the PDF. The tone is also friendly and conversational, which is acceptable. Overall, the agent conveyed the necessary information effectively, so it passes.

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) Confirm the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.
input: Hi Im from AL there is a bug in the website I get a 404. can you fix it?
expected_answer: Thanks for letting me know about the issue. First, what browser you're using to access the website?
agent_answer: Could you please tell me what browser you're using when encountering the bug on the website?
reason: The agent did not confirm the user is using the Google Chrome browser as instructed, which is a critical step. The output only asks about the browser without following through on the specific checks mentioned in the instruction. Furthermore, there is no indication of escalation if the issue persists after performing the checks. The output needs to include these steps to align with the instructions provided.

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) Confirm the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.
input: Hi im from georgia there is a bug in the website I get a 404 on my chrome. can you fix it?
expected_answer: Thanks for the details and for confirming you‚Äôre using Chrome. Next, can you please check that you have a strong and stable Wi-Fi connection, and then try again?
agent_answer: Is your WiFi working properly? It seems like a website issue, but ensuring your connection is stable can help us identify the problem accurately.
reason: The agent did not confirm that the user is using the Google Chrome browser, which is a key step in the instruction. Additionally, the agent's output lacks the required escalation step, as there is no indication that the case will be escalated to a support agent if the issue persists. While the tone is similar and the check for Wi-Fi connection is mentioned, the critical steps outlined are not fully followed.

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) Confirm the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.
input: Hi im from georgia there is a bug in the website I get a 404 on my chrome and my wifi works great on other sites. can you fix it?
expected_answer: Thanks for confirming you‚Äôre using Chrome and that your Wi-Fi connection is working well. Since the issue is still happening after those checks, I‚Äôll escalate this case to a support agent so they can investigate and help resolve it.
agent_answer: Hello! Thank you for reaching out about the issue you're facing. It sounds frustrating, and I understand how important it is to access the quoting process smoothly. I'll need to escalate your request to a human agent for further review and approval to ensure we can resolve this for you. They'll be able to assist you more effectively. Thank you for your patience! üåü
reason: The agent did not confirm whether the user is using Google Chrome or check the Wi-Fi connection, which are critical steps in the instructions. While the agent did mention escalating the issue, the failure to follow the initial necessary checks means it did not adhere to the instructions correctly.

instruction: When customers inquire about partnerships or product integrations, direct them to the partnership business development team by providing the email address partnerships@withfaye.com. Inform them that the team will respond if the inquiry is relevant.

instruction: If they want to see the policy (a copy of the policy/a sample policy/the full policy or some such wording) they can be directed to https://www.withfaye.com/coverage/ and scroll down to the bottom of the page to find all of our policies linked.

The tone is friendly and helpful, and while the agent's output contains more information (offering further assistance and emphasizing understanding before purchase), the core logic and information are consistent with the expected answer. instruction: Payments can be done on the website using any credit card, Paypal, or Apple Wallet/Google Pay. We cannot split up the payment to multiple payments/cards.
input: Hi, I'm from SC. I want to buy a policy but I‚Äôd like to split the payment between two different credit cards. Can you do that?

However, at this time, we do not have the option to split the payment across multiple cards. If you have any other questions or need further assistance, please feel free to let me know. instruction: If a customer asks about an existing policy or receipt, escalate the inquiry immediately without asking any follow-up questions.
input: Hi I'm from UT, I have policy number 43198791 and I think I got charged more than I should. Please tell me what went wrong.
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. Since this involves an existing policy and billing, I‚Äôll escalate your inquiry right away so the appropriate team can review it for you.

They'll be able to dive into the specifics of your charges and assist you further. Thank you for your patience! üòä
reason: The agent did not follow the instruction to escalate the inquiry immediately. instruction: Baggage and Personal Effects coverage provides reimbursement for personal items lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip, including while items are checked with a common carrier. The coverage may also include reimbursement for passport, visa, or credit card replacement, and baggage delay purchases if baggage is delayed for 12+ hours.
input: Hi, I'm from NC. Can you explain what the Baggage and Personal Effects coverage includes?
expected_answer: Sure! Baggage and Personal Effects coverage provides reimbursement for personal items that are lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip ‚Äî including when they‚Äôre checked with a common carrier. It may also cover reimbursement for replacing a passport, visa, or credit card, as well as purchases made if your baggage is delayed for 12 hours or more.
agent_answer:
Hello there! üòä I'd be happy to explain the Baggage and Personal Effects coverage for you.

This coverage helps by providing reimbursement for personal items that are lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip. It also covers situations when these items are checked in with a common carrier, like an airline. Additionally, you might be eligible for reimbursement for costs related to replacing passports, visas, or credit cards. If your baggage is delayed for over 12 hours, purchases you make during that delay might also be covered.

If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask! üåü
reason: The agent provided all the key information present in the expected answer, including details about reimbursement for lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed personal items, coverage for items checked with common carriers, reimbursement for replacing passports, visas, or credit cards, and coverage for purchases made during baggage delays of over 12 hours. The tone and format, although slightly different, remain friendly and informative, closely aligning with the expected response. Therefore, the core logic and critical details were accurately conveyed.

instruction: When answering questions about the government shutdown, clearly state that the policy does not cover incidents related to the shutdown if the event was known at the time of purchase. For policies purchased after October 1, incidents related to the government shutdown are not covered, as the shutdown became a known event on October 1.
input: Hi, I'm from CO. I'm worried the government shutdown might delay my trip. If I buy a policy now, will I be covered for issues caused by the shutdown?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. The government shutdown became a known event on October 1, so any policies purchased after that date do not provide coverage for incidents related to the shutdown. Because it‚Äôs already a known event, issues caused by it would not be covered.
agent_answer:
Hello! üòä I understand your concern about the government shutdown impacting your travel plans. All policy coverages are meant to apply to unknown events. Since the government shutdown became a known event on October 1, unfortunately, policies purchased after this date may not cover incidents related to it.

instruction: Rental car insurance is not available for residents of Hawaii. When available, rental car coverage must be added as an optional benefit during plan selection. If added, it protects a rental vehicle for the duration of the trip by reimbursing the traveler for: physical damage to the rental car due to collision, vandalism, theft, natural disaster, or events beyond the traveler‚Äôs control; theft of the vehicle (if unrecovered); loss-of-use charges or administrative fees charged by the rental agency.
input: Hi, I'm from CA and I'm renting a car in Italy. Can you explain what your rental car coverage includes?
expected_answer: Sure! Rental car coverage can be added as an optional benefit during plan selection. It reimburses you for physical damage to the rental vehicle caused by collision, vandalism, theft, natural disasters, or events outside your control. It also covers theft of the vehicle if it isn‚Äôt recovered, as well as loss-of-use charges or administrative fees from the rental agency.
agent_answer:
Hello! üòä Renting a car in Italy sounds exciting! I‚Äôd be happy to explain our rental car coverage for you.

When you choose to add rental car coverage to your plan, it protects you and your vehicle throughout your trip in several ways:

- **Physical Damage:** Coverage includes protection against any damage to the rental car due to incidents such as collisions, vandalism, theft, natural disasters, or any other events beyond your control.
  
- **Theft Protection:** If unfortunately the vehicle is stolen and not recovered, you're covered.
  
- **Charges from the Rental Agency:** We also cover any loss-of-use charges or administrative fees that might be charged by the rental agency due to the car being out of service.

If you have more questions or need help with anything else, feel free to ask! Safe travels! üöó‚ú®
